isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500, 8600 Models Built After 05/19/2003 - CHASSIS FEATURES - PYROMETER/AMMETER MODULE (PAM)

svcproc.title: CIRCUIT FUNCTIONS
svcproc.para: The pyrometer/ammeter module (PAM) is capable of sensing and reporting both temperature and current. The temperature sensing capability is not currently being utilized, therefore only the ammeter circuit is described here.

The module provides a current value (net battery current) by measuring the differential voltage between the battery negative terminal and the starter ground stud. Circuitry within the module converts the measured voltage into an equivalent current value. This information is reported to the ESC, Electronic Gauge Cluster (EGC), and/or the Auxiliary Gauge Switch Pack (AGSP) via the drivetrain J1939 data link. The information eventually is used to drive the ammeter.
